intro: Erigeron breweri var. ensenadensis, commonly known as the Ensénada blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Chihuahuan Desert in Mexico. It is characterized by its delicate blue to purple flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. This variant is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from other Erigeron species.
